info.description: Trigger Rule evaluations for Rules created and subscribed to within Risk Radar.
info.title: Risk Governance - Rule Evaluation

get.description: Get the latest state of a long-running operation from triggering the evaluator
get.summary: Get latest state of a long-running operation

get.description: Retrieve rule evaluations matching the parameters provided.

parameters.description: A unique identifier for this request.
parameters.name: VND.com.blackrock.Request-ID

parameters.description: Timestamp assigned to this request at origin, in "HTTP-date" format as defined by RFC 7231.
parameters.name: VND.com.blackrock.Origin-Timestamp

parameters.description:
Used to provide with https://google.aip.dev/160 filtering capabilities 
(-- api-linter: core::0124::required-reference=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: this is in compliance with https://google.aip.dev/160 filtering capabilities --).
parameters.name: filter

parameters.description: The offset value used to set the starting point into the result set found at the repository.
parameters.name: pageToken

parameters.description:
The number of entries to be returned as a response
The maximum value is 100. If unspecified, the default value is 5.
parameters.name: pageSize

parameters.description:
Used to specify the ordering of the returned entries by evaluationTime. 
The supported syntax: [target field]:asc or [target field]:desc.
parameters.name: orderBy

parameters.description:
Used for facet search capabilities by simply specifying the fields to be used as a base.
Response will contain an array for each of the specified fields and it's terms and matches for each of the entries
(-- api-linter: core::0132::request-unknown-fields=disabled aip.dev/not-precedent: 
 We need to do this because we need this field for facet search capabilities --).
parameters.name: facetFields

parameters.description:
When provided, retrieves rule evaluations that have an as of date matching the specified date
If provided, startEvalTime will default to that date.
(-- api-linter: core::0132::request-unknown-fields=disabled aip.dev/not-precedent:
 We need to do this because we need this field to specify the as of date of evaluations --).
parameters.name: asOfDate

parameters.description:
When provided, retrieves rule evaluations that have an evaluationTime greater than or equal to the time specified.
If absent, the last 24 hours will be shown prior to the endEvalTime(if provided) or the time of the request.
(-- api-linter: core::0132::request-unknown-fields=disabled aip.dev/not-precedent:
 We need to do this because we need this field to specify the time range for a search --).
parameters.name: startEvalTime

parameters.description:
When provided, retrieves rule evaluations that have an evaluationTime less than or equal to the time specified.
If absent, the endEvalTime defaults to the time of the request.
(-- api-linter: core::0132::request-unknown-fields=disabled aip.dev/not-precedent:
 We need to do this because we need this field to specify the time range for a search --).
parameters.name: endEvalTime

Any.description:
`Any` contains an arbitrary serialized message along with a
URL that describes the type of the serialized message

@type.description: A URL/resource name that uniquely identifies the type of the serialized message.

rpcStatus.description:
The `Status` type defines a logical error model that is suitable for
different programming environments, including REST APIs and RPC APIs. It is
used by [gRPC](https://github.com/grpc). Each `Status` message contains
three pieces of data: error code, error message, and error details.

You can find out more about this error model and how to work with it in the
[API Design Guide](https://cloud.google.com/apis/design/errors).

code.description: The status code, which should be an enum value of [google.rpc.Code][google.rpc.Code].

message.description:
A developer-facing error message, which should be in English. Any
user-facing error message should be localized and sent in the
[google.rpc.Status.details][google.rpc.Status.details] field, or localized by the client.

details.description:
A list of messages that carry the error details.  There is a common set of
message types for APIs to use.

v1ConditionDetail.title:
The relevant information/definitions to be used in conjunction with
condition definitions ans results

metricUnit.title: The metric unit to be used when evaluating the condition

breakdownType.title: The type of breakdown applied with this condition, specified by the evaluator

containsBreakdown.title: Indicates whether the condition contains a breakdown

ruleOverrideId.description:
Unique identifier of the RiskRuleOverride applied to this condition.
If present, it indicates some properties of the condition have been set from a RiskRuleOverride that is in effect.

ruleOverrideVersion.title: The rule_override_version identifier for this particular revision of the rule override

metricSource.title: Metric source to be used for evaluation

v1ConditionResult.title: The condition definition for sector results related evaluations

id.title: Unique identifier, which should map to the corresponding Rule condition id if applicable

conditionDetail.title: The additional information about the condition

sectorResults.title: The sector results resulting from the evaluation of the condition

evaluationState.title: The overall evaluation state resulting from the evaluation of the condition

v1EvaluatePortfolioRequest.title: A request payload which contains the information used to trigger the evaluator

asOfDate.title: The date for when you want the evaluation to be run

v1EvaluatePortfolioRuleRequest.title: A request payload which contains the information used to trigger the evaluator for a single rule

asOfDate.title: The date for when you want the evaluation to be run

v1EvaluationState.description:
- EVALUATION_STATE_UNSPECIFIED: No definition present (not a valid input value)
 - EVALUATION_STATE_BREACH: High severity state signalling that the evaluation has identified a BREACH
 - EVALUATION_STATE_WARNING: Lower severity state signalling that the valuation has identified a WARNING
 - EVALUATION_STATE_OK: OK state signalling that a prior exception is no longer an exception and is to
be closed out by the system
v1EvaluationState.title: The possible outcomes from an evaluation

v1Limit.title: Defines the numerical thresholds associated with a Condition of a Rule

limitType.title:
Indicates how the numerical limits are being represented.
(-- api-linter: aladdin::0901::dictionary-message-field=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because lint error is for resource defined in other domain --)

target.title:
The target value for the metric bound to this limit.
This is optional if the limit type is Absolute, but required if it is Relative.
(-- api-linter: core::0203::optional=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because the required/optional behaviour is
 conditional on the limit_type property, which cannot be enforced at the schema-level --)
(-- api-linter: core::0203::required=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because the required/optional behaviour is
 conditional on the limit_type property, which cannot be enforced at the schema-level --)

thresholds.description:
Specifies the individual thresholds captured for this limit and their numerical values. 
The permitted keys are 'upperBreach', 'upperWarning', 'lowerWarning', 'lowerBreach'. 
A limit has at least one entry specified.

v1LimitType.description:
- LIMIT_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED: No definition present
 - LIMIT_TYPE_ABSOLUTE: An absolute threshold level, e.g. 250 bps tracking error
 - LIMIT_TYPE_RELATIVE: A relative threshold level, e.g. 1.2 which is then multiplied with the target value
v1LimitType.title:
The limit type indicating whether thresholds are specified in absolute terms
or relative to the target value

v1ListRuleEvaluationsResponse.title: The response message for checking rule evaluation history

navigation.title: Links used to navigate through the available entries matching the specified criteria found at the repository

count.title: The number of entries returned with the current response

total.title: The number of entries matching the specified criterias at the repository

searchFacets.title: A map of all the facet result terms

ruleEvaluations.title: A list of Evaluation results generated by rule evaluation

v1LongrunningOperation.description:
LongrunningOperation represents a long-running operation that is the result
of a network API call.

id.description:
The server-assigned id, which is only unique within the same service that
originally returns it. If you use the default HTTP mapping, the
`id` should have the format of `operations/some/unique/id`.

meta.description:
Service-specific metadata associated with the operation.  It typically
contains progress information and common metadata such as create time.
Some services might not provide such metadata.  Any method that returns a
long-running operation should document the metadata type, if any.

done.description:
If the value is `false`, it means the operation is still in progress.
If true, the operation is completed, and either `error` or `response` is
available.

error.description: The error result of the operation in case of failure or cancellation.

response.description:
The normal response of the operation in case of success.  If the original
method returns no data on success, such as `Delete`, the response is
`google.protobuf.Empty`.  If the original method is standard
`Get`/`Create`/`Update`, the response should be the resource.  For other
methods, the response should have the type `XxxResponse`, where `Xxx`
is the original method name.  For example, if the original method name
is `TakeSnapshot()`, the inferred response type is
`TakeSnapshotResponse`.

v1MetricSource.description:
- METRIC_SOURCE_UNSPECIFIED: No definition present
 - METRIC_SOURCE_ALADDIN_ANALYTICS: Evaluator will use Aladdin Analytics as metric source
 - METRIC_SOURCE_CUSTOM: Evaluator will use CUSTOM DATA as metric source
v1MetricSource.title: Allowed metric sources

v1MetricUnit.description:
- METRIC_UNIT_UNSPECIFIED: No definition present
 - METRIC_UNIT_BPS: Basis Points
 - METRIC_UNIT_PCT: Percent
 - METRIC_UNIT_NONE: Comment placeholder
v1MetricUnit.title: The units in which the metric and its thresholds are specified

v1PortfolioAnalyticsBenchmarkConfig.title:
PortfolioAnalyticsBenchmarkConfig represents the benchmark to be used for analysis
This currently represents a benchmark type and order

benchmarkType.title: Specifies benchmark type like RISK, PERFORMANCE, FORWARD, OTHER, NONE

benchmarkOrder.title:
Specifies which benchmark should be used 
(-- api-linter: aladdin::0901::dictionary-message-field=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because this is aligned with Explore UI --)

benchmarkTicker.title: Specifies benchmark ticker. This field is only needed when BenchmarkType = OTHER

v1PortfolioAnalyticsBenchmarkOrder.description:
- PORTFOLIO_ANALYTICS_BENCHMARK_ORDER_UNSPECIFIED: Unspecfied value
 - PORTFOLIO_ANALYTICS_BENCHMARK_ORDER_PRIMARY: Represents the primary order benchmark
 - PORTFOLIO_ANALYTICS_BENCHMARK_ORDER_SECONDARY: Represents the secondary order benchmark
v1PortfolioAnalyticsBenchmarkOrder.title:
BenchmarkOrder represents which benchmark should be chosen
if multiple are avaialble. Default is BENCHMARK_ORDER_PRIMARY

v1RiskException.description: Representation of Risk Exception, its available fields and the flexible one "exceptionDetail" to store more specific details.

externalId.title: The unique user-specified identifier for the exception (not used by the system)

validBeginDate.title:
The date on which the exception record is valid. Dictated by the date of the 
underlying positions used to calculate the exception. In most instances, 
the beginning date of the exceptions may precede the creation date (e.g. T-1 or T-2)

validEndDate.title:
The date at which the exception record stops being valid, e.g. it is superseded by a new 
record on the following day or because it has been closed out

entryTime.title: The timestamp when the record entered the system

expiryTime.title: The INTERNAL timestamp when the record expires

createTime.title: The timestamp when the first time-series risk entry was first created

modifier.title: Identifies the modifier of the exception

workflowId.title: The workflow Id which the exception is associated with

scopeId.title: The unique identifier of the scope of the exception. E.g. for a portfolio, this should be the portoflio code

scopeType.title: The scope of the exception e.g. one of 'GLOBAL', 'PORTFOLIO_GROUP', 'PORTFOLIO', 'OTHER'

scope.title: The name of the scope, e.g. the porfolio name

entityId.title: The unique identifier of the entity the exception refers to. E.g. for an issuer, this should be the issuer code

entityType.title:
Used to determine the type of entity the exception refers to, e.g. one of 
'PORTFOLIO_GROUP', 'PORTFOLIO', 'SECTOR', 'FACTOR', 'ISSUER', 'SECURITY', 'OTHER'

entity.title: The name of the entity that the exception is concerned with

evaluationState.title: The status set by the evaluation process. Currently supported: BREACH, WARNING and OK

rulePriority.title: The priority as provided by the rule that generated the exception and used as a common way to rank exceptions across rules

ruleId.title: The ID of the Rule that the exception is based on

ruleVersion.title: The ID of the specific version of the Rule that the exception is based on

exceptionTier.title: Visibility tier/level of the exception e.g. Prime/Prod, Beta, Testing, Local, Team etc

evaluationResults.title: The results from evaluating the Rule Conditions the exception is based on

exceptionDetails.title: Any additional details that custom exception producers may store alongside the exception to provide additional context

v1RiskFacetSearchEntry.title: Description of a facet search entry

term.title: The term representing a facet unit

count.title: The number of entries matching the term

v1RiskFacetSearchList.title: The values of a facet search listing

facets.title: The facet search results used mainly by the UI

v1RiskNavigationLinks.description: Class to carry the links to be used when navigating across the data matched by a given criteria.

self.title: Link to the current set of data

first.title: Link to the first chunk of data matching the given criteria

previous.title: Link to the previuos chunk of data matching the given criteria

next.title: Link to the next chunk of data matching the given criteria

last.title: Latest chunk of chunk of data matching the given criteria

v1RuleEvaluation.title:
(-- api-linter: core::9050::result-message-fields=disabled
    aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because the rule is applied in wrapper object --)
The result of each rule evaluation

ruleExecutionState.title: The outcome of the rule evaluation execution, either SUCCESS, PARTIAL_FAILURE or FAILURE

scopeId.title:
(-- api-linter: core::0124::required-reference=disabled
    aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because scope_id is generic and the resource is defined by the scope_type. --)
The unique identifier of the scope of the exception. E.g. for a portfolio, this should be the portoflio code

scopeType.title: The scope of the exception e.g. one of 'GLOBAL', 'PORTFOLIO_GROUP', 'PORTFOLIO', 'OTHER'

asOfDate.title: The date for which the rule has been evaluated

evaluationState.title:
(-- api-linter: aladdin::0901::dictionary-message-field=disabled
    aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because it follows the risk-governance typing of evaluation_state which already exists --)
The evaluated state of the sector result indicating the exception severity (or OK)

conditionCount.title: Count of the conditions run for the rule

failedConditionIds.title: List of unique identifiers for failed conditions populated when rule_execution_state is PARTIAL_FAILURE

exceptions.title: List of RiskExceptions generated by rule evaluation

scope.title: The name of the scope, e.g. the porfolio name

ruleVersion.title: The ID of the specific version of the Rule that the exception is based on

evaluationTime.title: The timestamp for when the request for evaluation was received

evaluationStartTime.title: The timestamp for when the evaluation was started

evaluationFinishTime.title: The timestamp for when the evaluation was completed

trigger.title: How the evaluation was triggered, e.g. User, System - Released, System - Rerun

triggeringUser.title: Who the evaluation was triggered by, e.g. tsgop or UI user

errorMessage.title: In case of FAILURE/PARTIAL_FAILURE ruleEvaluationState this will be used to record the reason for failure

ruleEvaluations.title: A list of Evaluation results generated by rule evaluation

v1RuleEvaluationListMetaData.title:
Metadata for longrunning operation
Currently it is not possible to determine progress, but it may be possible in the future

v1RuleEvaluationListResponse.title: Individual response message for evaluation trigger endpoints

error.description: The error result of the operation in case of failure or cancellation.

output.description: The normal response of the operation in case of success.

v1RuleExecutionState.description:
- RULE_EXECUTION_STATE_UNSPECIFIED: No definition present (not a valid input value)
 - RULE_EXECUTION_STATE_SUCCESS: Rule evaluation completed successfully
 - RULE_EXECUTION_STATE_PARTIAL_FAILURE: Rule evaluation completed with failures
 - RULE_EXECUTION_STATE_FAILURE: Unable to evaluate rule
v1RuleExecutionState.title: The status of the rule evaluation execution, either SUCCESS, PARTIAL_FAILURE or FAILURE

v1SectorResult.title:
It represents the evaluation results
for specific category values for the selected breakdown

lastThresholdCrossed.title: The most severe predefined threshold crossed when performing an evaluation

evaluationState.title: The evaluated state of the sector result indicating the exception severity (or OK)

actualValue.title: The actual value of the underlying metric being validated against the Rule Condition limits

limit.title: The numerical thresholds associated with the corresponding Rule Condition

v1Threshold.description:
- THRESHOLD_UNSPECIFIED: No definition present
 - THRESHOLD_UPPER_BREACH: An evaluation has identified a scenario which the values are beyond any pre-defined limit
 - THRESHOLD_LOWER_BREACH: An evaluation has identified a scenario which the values are somewhere
in betewen OK and UPPER_BREACH
 - THRESHOLD_UPPER_WARNING: An evaluation has identified a scenario where the values are close 
but not yet to be considered a breach
 - THRESHOLD_LOWER_WARNING: An evaluation has identified a scenario where the values are on
the way to be considered a breach
v1Threshold.title:
The available threshold levels to be used in order to better identify
the most severe problems

OAuth2AccessCode.description: This API uses OAuth 2.0 with the access code flow.

scopes.offline_access: This keeps you signed in to the app, even when you are not using it.

OAuth2ClientCredentials.description: This API uses OAuth 2.0 with the client credentials flow.

scopes.offline_access: This keeps you signed in to the app, even when you are not using it.
